ANGULAR.Defintion: having or relating to one or more angles, not having smooth sides

ASPHALT.Defintion: a black, sticky substance, often mixed with small stones or sand, that forms a strong surface when it becomes hard

BAREFOOT.Defintion: not wearing any shoes or socks

BRIBING.Defintion: to try to make someone do something for you by giving them money, presents, or something else that they want

BUNKERS.Defintion: in golf, a hollow area of ground filled with sand, that is difficult to hit a ball out of

CEMENT.Defintion: a grey powder that is mixed with water and sand to make mortar or with water, sand, and small stones to make concrete

CLOCKING IN.Defintion: usually used to refer to when you start work, but here is used for dramatic effect, and is just a synonym for 'is'

CONCRETE.Defintion: a very hard building material made by mixing together cement, sand, small stones, and water

CONSUME.Defintion: to use fuel, energy, or time, especially in large amounts

CORRUPT.Defintion: dishonestly using your position or power to get an advantage, especially for money

CUBIC.Defintion: used in units of volume to show when the length of something has been multiplied by its width and height

DUNES.Defintion: a hill of sand near a beach or in a desert

ECOLOGICAL.Defintion: relating to ecology or the environment

ECOSYSTEM.Defintion: all the living things in an area and the way they affect each other and the environment

EXCESS.Defintion: an amount that is more than acceptable, expected, or reasonable

EXTRACTING.Defintion: to remove or take out something

FINE.Defintion: very thin or in very small pieces or drops

FOUNDATION.Defintion: the structures below the surface of the ground that support a building

GRAINS.Defintion: a seed or seeds from a plant, especially a plant like a grass such as rice or wheat

GRAVEL.Defintion: small, rounded stones, often mixed with sand

IMPORTED.Defintion: to buy or bring in products from another country

INFINITE.Defintion: without limits; extremely large or great

INFRASTRUCTURE.Defintion: the basic systems and services, such as transport and power supplies, that a country or organisation uses in order to work effectively

INHABITANTS.Defintion: a person or animal that lives in a particular place

MAFIAS.Defintion: a criminal organisation that began in Sicily and is active in Italy and the US, often used as a synonym for 'organised crime gang'

OUTSTRIPS.Defintion: to be or become greater in amount, degree, or success than something or someone

PACE.Defintion: the speed at which someone or something moves, or with which something happens or changes

PARTICLES.Defintion: an extremely small piece of matter

PHENOMENAL.Defintion: extremely successful or special, especially in a surprising way

REITERATE.Defintion: to say something again, once or several times

RUN OUT.Defintion: to finish, use, or sell all of something, so that there is none left

RUNWAYS.Defintion: a long specially prepared hard surface like a road on which aircraft land and take off

SINK.Defintion: to (cause something or someone to) go down below the surface or to the bottom of a liquid or soft substance

SMALL-FRY.Defintion: people or things that are not considered to be important

TEMPORARY.Defintion: not lasting or needed for very long

TREKKING.Defintion: the activity of walking long distances on foot for pleasure

TRUCKS.Defintion: a large road vehicle that is used for transporting large amounts of goods

TURN A BLIND EYE.Defintion: ignore something that you know is wrong

URBANISATION.Defintion: the process by which more and more people leave the countryside to live in cities‚Äç
